_header: The chance of love and eke the pain of Amoryus the knight
_description: John Metham, Amoryus and Cleopes — 2211 lines in rhyme toyal stanzas

PULGar141.First Lines:
The chaunȝ of loue and eke þe peyn of amoryus þe
                    knygtffor cleopes sake and eke how bothe in ffere…
PULGar141.Last Lines:
…ffor tyme on ocupyis qwan ffolk haue lytyl to doIn haly dayis
                    to rede me thynk yt best so…
PULGar141.Note:
Text of further one and a half stanzas erased from f. 56v,
                    now illegible.
PULGar141.Attributed Title:
Thys ys þe story off a knyght howe he dyd many wurthy dedys be þe
                    help off a lady þe qwyche taught hym to ouercome a meruulus dragon þe
                    qwyche was an C ffote longe And þis knyght was clepyd Amoryus & þe
                    lady cleopes (f. 17); Here endyth þe story off amoryus þe knyght &
                    off cleopes þe lady (f. 56v)
